title: westernlove
author: westernlove
content: As a dedicated fan of iPolloMiner, I'm excited to introduce their latest innovation, the V1Hyd. This remarkable mining machine offers an impressive hash rate of 850MH/s, all while maintaining an efficient power consumption of just 690 watts. But that's not all – the V1Hyd is designed to be a true game-changer with its cutting-edge water cooling technology, ensuring not only optimal performance but also an almost whisper-quiet operation.In the world of cryptocurrency mining, having a balance between power and efficiency is crucial, and the V1Hyd seems to have found that sweet spot. With its high hash rate and low power consumption, miners can enjoy the benefits of enhanced profitability while keeping their energy costs under control.One of the standout features of the V1Hyd is its water cooling system. By utilizing this advanced technology, iPolloMiner has not only optimized the mining process but also addressed the issue of excessive noise that can often come with traditional cooling methods. The result is a mining machine that doesn't just deliver impressive results but does so in a near-silent manner.For those who are looking to take their mining operations to the next level, the V1Hyd is a compelling choice. Its remarkable hash rate, energy efficiency, and innovative cooling technology make it a standout option in the market. As a loyal supporter of iPolloMiner, I can confidently say that the V1Hyd is a testament to their commitment to pushing the boundaries of mining technology.In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency mining, iPolloMiner continues to lead the way with products like the V1Hyd, embodying their slogan: "iPolloMiner, for home miners." This new addition to their lineup is sure to capture the attention of miners worldwide, and I can't wait to see the impact it makes on the mining community.check here: https://ipollo.com/products/ipollo-v1h?variant=44057620349146

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: I do not see any profit on this ASIC. With its cost of $ 1,200, I have a daily profit of 78 cents at a price of 5 cents per kilowatt. And this is assuming that there is 5.8 GB of memory. Jasminer X16-P and Antminer E9 Pro have better energy efficiency.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on September 03, 2023, 01:03:01 PMI do not see any profit on this ASIC. With its cost of $ 1,200, I have a daily profit of 78 cents at a price of 5 cents per kilowatt. And this is assuming that there is 5.8 GB of memory. Jasminer X16-P and Antminer E9 Pro have better energy efficiency.Efficiency of this miner is one of the best and is geared toward home miners,I see a profit of over 1 dollar excluding electricity even more than 5 cents per kilowatt,at least that is what 2cryptocalc ETC calculator is showing to me,nevertheless even if it is not that profitable,I think even if there is 5.8 GB memory is enough to mine ETC easily.The power consumption is great for home users as I run a 100 Mhsh 2 GPU rig with 210 watt and this machine makes x8 hashrate with just x3 energy consumption,that is a great device but as I said for the home miner,for the enthusiast miner,mining farms can stick with their E9 from Bitmain.

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on September 03, 2023, 08:40:24 PMQuote from: FP91G on September 03, 2023, 01:03:01 PMI do not see any profit on this ASIC. With its cost of $ 1,200, I have a daily profit of 78 cents at a price of 5 cents per kilowatt. And this is assuming that there is 5.8 GB of memory. Jasminer X16-P and Antminer E9 Pro have better energy efficiency.Efficiency of this miner is one of the best and is geared toward home miners,I see a profit of over 1 dollar excluding electricity even more than 5 cents per kilowatt,at least that is what 2cryptocalc ETC calculator is showing to me,nevertheless even if it is not that profitable,I think even if there is 5.8 GB memory is enough to mine ETC easily.The power consumption is great for home users as I run a 100 Mhsh 2 GPU rig with 210 watt and this machine makes x8 hashrate with just x3 energy consumption,that is a great device but as I said for the home miner,for the enthusiast miner,mining farms can stick with their E9 from Bitmain.Ehm he is right the power consumption is bad, i mean over 1w per 1mh, jazzminer beat this with up to 3x times. The X16-P give 3mh per watt with 8GB. 5.8Gb is not enough to mine your lovely ETHW for long time

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on September 03, 2023, 08:40:24 PMQuote from: FP91G on September 03, 2023, 01:03:01 PMI do not see any profit on this ASIC. With its cost of $ 1,200, I have a daily profit of 78 cents at a price of 5 cents per kilowatt. And this is assuming that there is 5.8 GB of memory. Jasminer X16-P and Antminer E9 Pro have better energy efficiency.Efficiency of this miner is one of the best and is geared toward home miners,I see a profit of over 1 dollar excluding electricity even more than 5 cents per kilowatt,at least that is what 2cryptocalc ETC calculator is showing to me,nevertheless even if it is not that profitable,I think even if there is 5.8 GB memory is enough to mine ETC easily.The power consumption is great for home users as I run a 100 Mhsh 2 GPU rig with 210 watt and this machine makes x8 hashrate with just x3 energy consumption,that is a great device but as I said for the home miner,for the enthusiast miner,mining farms can stick with their E9 from Bitmain.Where is the profit?https://www.minerlist.com/coin/ethereum-classic/calculatorSuch an ASIC will never pay off, or do you want to use it in solo mining?I don’t understand why such ASICs should be released, if its profit for 3 years will be 300 dollars at the moment. But the hashrate will grow and the price of electricity will also grow, and the ASIC does not work without breakdowns.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Same Here with Nicehash tho the price is relatively cheap

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: dansus021 on September 15, 2023, 01:30:16 AMSame Here with Nicehash tho the price is relatively cheap EtHash ASIC with characteristics of 850MH/s and 690 watts has been outdated for a long time.Model X16-P from Jasminer mining EtHash algorithm with a maximum hashrate of 5.8Gh/s for a power consumption of 1900Whttps://www.asicminervalue.com/miners/jasminer/x16-pFor industrial mining, small ASICs are unprofitable and not energy efficient. If these are quiet ASICs for an apartment, then I don’t understand their economic meaning. I hope they are not for solo mining effetherium classic.
